Detailed Description

A reference to a tone that should be based on custom data, such as data in the Flash File System. Tones are simple sounds made by the DSP chip

Member Typedef Documentation

Member Function Documentation

SharedPtr< CustomToneAudioReference > CustomToneAudioReference::Create (  const void *  tone_data,
ToneType  tone_type,
UINT32  no_of_tones
)  [static]
 

Create an instance.

Parameters:
tone_data A buffer of tone data. The size of this buffer is determined by the tone_type and no_of_tones parameter.
tone_type The Type of tone. Different tone types require different tone_data formats. Here are the formats for the tone_data buffer:
  • NormalTone: Sequential blocks of data, of this format: UINT16 frequency1; INT16 amplitude1; UINT16 duration;

  • DualTone: Sequential blocks of data, of this format: UINT16 frequency1; INT16 amplitude1; UINT16 frequency2; INT16 amplitude2; UINT16 duration;

  • TripleTone: Sequential blocks of data, of this format: UINT16 frequency1; INT16 amplitude1; UINT16 frequency2; INT16 amplitude2; UINT16 frequency3; INT16 amplitude3; UINT16 duration;

For instance, a NormalTone tone_data buffer might be defined like this:

 struct NormalToneBlock
 {
   UINT16 frequency1;   
   INT16 amplitude1;
   UINT16 duration;     
 };
    
 NormalToneBlock custom_tone_normal[] = {
 // Frequency, amplitude , duration (ms)
    { 350   , 0x2000    , 1000},
    { 550   , 0x2000    , 500},
    { 750   , 0x2000    , 500},
    { 950   , 0x4000    , 500},
    {1150   , 0x4000    , 500},
    {1350   , 0x4000    , 500},
    {1550   , 0x4000    , 500},
    {1750   , 0x4000    , 500},
 };

Parameters:
no_of_tones How many blocks of tone data are in the tone_data buffer.
Returns:
A new instance.
